intro: Tupa bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored tupa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, typically featuring a white base and a pink or purple upper portion. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and upright. Tupa bicolor thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
